Now for the pack. I've got options: The Moon, The Magician (Lucky Cards), The World, Death, and The Empress (Mult Cards).  Enhancements are what Vampire eats, so that guides my choice. The Magician and Empress both offer enhancements, so that is the decision to make. Death isn't worth it since I only have 2 enhancements in my hand already and Death would make one new one.  Empress and Magician are each a +2. The Moon and World don't help Vampire, even though Spades are good for a Flush.

My hand has a mix of Spades, Diamonds, and Clubs. Since I'm eyeing the long game, let's look at the best option for Vampire's diet. The Empress is the better move, so I'll target cards 1 (Ace of Spades) and 2 (Jack of Spades) in my hand with The Empress from position 5 in the pack. It doesn't matter much whether I pick Magician or Empress, but Empress at least gives me a boost to the hand before the Vampire gets to eat the card.

So, the action will be `select 5 1 2`.  I'm focusing on Vampire scaling, so Spades don't give any advantage in this case. Also, it might be possible to duplicate an existing enhancement, but it provides less benefit. The Vampire is king.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

reasoning:
**Analyzing the Shop and Planning the Next Move**

Okay, so I'm in Ante 8, Round 22. I've got $92, which is more than enough for now since I'm already maxing out on interest ($20 with To the Moon, which is a bit disappointing that it's not higher, but I'll take it). My main focus is beating this boss, and my build revolves around a Flush hand boosted by the Vampire and Baseball Card. The Vampire is crucial; currently at X3.9 and I need to keep feeding it.

I've got a decent Joker setup: Bootstraps for some flat Mult, To the Moon (which is fine), the all-important Vampire, Baseball Card amplifying my Uncommons (four total: Bootstraps, To the Moon, Vampire, Marble Joker), and Hallucination (which wasn't helpful last time) and Marble Joker for potential Stone cards which are Vampire food. Baseball Card is giving me a decent multiplier on my uncommons: 1.5^4 = 5.0625x. My Flush is at level 7 (125 chips, 16 mult).

In the shop, I see Strength and Neptune for sale. Neither is ideal. Strength isn't useful for this build because it doesn't give enhancements. Buying Neptune to level up the Straight Flush is cheap, but it's not the main focus right now. The shop is exhausted of boosters.

My immediate goal is to find more Tarot cards or Planet cards to feed the Vampire and boost my multiplier. My total multiplier is around 1000x at the moment. I need more scaling. I really need to get the Vampire to X10 or higher. Reroll is $5. I think that's the best option here, for a couple of reasons: I'm well above the interest cap and I'm looking for upgrades.

I need to think this through carefully. Let's see...I could reroll and hope for some great Tarot cards (Empress, Magician, Hierophant) or a Jupiter. Magic Trick is active but I don't really care. I want a good Tarot draw. Even an upgrade to my Jokers would be fantastic. The cards in the shop are weak. Strength and Neptune. Ugh.

Okay, let's look at the numbers again. Vampire x3.9, Baseball Card scaling on four Uncommons. Let's calculate the real multiplier. Flush is at base 16x + 36 from Bootstraps = 52. With the Baseball Card and four Uncommons, I have a decent base to begin. I have to think about the best use of my money. Since my hand last turn was full of Mult cards, I should get rid of cards that don't help Vampire.

I can't *use* Strength without a target, and it doesn't feed the Vampire anyway. Marble Joker adds a Stone card when a Blind is selected, but the shop is weak. I need to get out of the shop.

Rerolling seems like the best use of funds. I'll reroll the shop to try to find something better. My final conclusion is to buy nothing and `reroll_shop`.
